docs.snippet: The U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee said on Monday it had invited the chief executive officers of Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc to testify at an April 10 hearing on data privacy.

headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing
headline.main: Facebook CEO Among Those Invited to Testify at U.S. Senate Hearing

docs.snippet: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany cast doubt over the level of trust people have in Facebook over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologizing to users.

headline.print_headline: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data
headline.main: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data

docs.snippet: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she hoped Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg understood why people were concerned about alleged leaks of personal data, but it was up to him to decide whether to face a committee in Britain's parliamen...

headline.print_headline: UK's May Says She Hopes Facebook Boss Understands Data Leak Concerns
headline.main: UK's May Says She Hopes Facebook Boss Understands Data Leak Concerns

docs.snippet: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany indicated that a majority of the public were losing trust in Facebook over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologizing to users.

headline.print_headline: Polls Show Facebook Losing Trust as Firm Uses Ads to Apologize
headline.main: Polls Show Facebook Losing Trust as Firm Uses Ads to Apologize

docs.snippet: The scandal over data privacy that is causing a headache for Facebook Inc shows just one aspect of the huge task of preparing the world for e-commerce, the United Nations trade and development agency UNCTAD said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Privacy Debate Is Tip of the e-Commerce Iceberg, U.N. Says
headline.main: Facebook Privacy Debate Is Tip of the e-Commerce Iceberg, U.N. Says

docs.snippet: A scandal engulfing Facebook over the use of its data by political consultants widened on Tuesday when a whistleblower said Canadian company AggregateIQ had developed a program to target Republican voters in the 2016 U.S. election.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Data Scandal Widens as Canadian Company Accused of Helping Target U.S. Voters
headline.main: Facebook Data Scandal Widens as Canadian Company Accused of Helping Target U.S. Voters

docs.snippet: The news that Facebook's Android app has been collecting call and text histories is yet another black eye for the social media giant. But just why was Facebook able to siphon off records of who its users were contacting — and when — in...

headline.print_headline: How Facebook Was Able to Siphon Off Phone Call and Text Logs
headline.main: How Facebook Was Able to Siphon Off Phone Call and Text Logs

docs.snippet: Fewer than half of Americans trust Facebook to obey U.S. privacy laws, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Sunday, illustrating the challenge facing the social media network after a scandal over its handling of personal information.

headline.print_headline: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data: Reuters/Ipsos Poll
headline.main: Americans Less Likely to Trust Facebook Than Rivals on Personal Data: Reuters/Ipsos Poll

docs.snippet: Investigators from Britain's data watchdog on Friday searched the London offices of Cambridge Analytica, the data analytics firm at the centre of a storm over allegations it improperly harvested Facebook data to target U.S. voters.

headline.print_headline: UK Investigators Search London Office of Firm at Centre of Facebook Data Storm
headline.main: UK Investigators Search London Office of Firm at Centre of Facebook Data Storm

docs.snippet: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is promising to do a better job protecting user data following reports that a political consultant misused the personal information of millions of the company's subscribers. The fact is, European regulators are already...

headline.print_headline: Watch It, Facebook: New EU Data Rules May Have Broad Impact
headline.main: Watch It, Facebook: New EU Data Rules May Have Broad Impact
